channel.title: Help with multiple worlds? [PI]
channel.description:
Okay so what I'm trying to do is have two worlds that connect through different ports I put codes in client.java (client sided) but now both worlds only connnect through port 43595?
World 1 should connect through port 43594 and world 2 should connect through port 43595
here is my client.java if you can see any issues or errors in code that may be causing this can you please help?? :(
[url=https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/20957550/client.java]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/20957550/client.java[/url]

item.title: Help with multiple worlds? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

Flame_:

Stay on topic, please.

Agreed, I’m still back where I started. The tutorial in the link just gave me a lot of errors. All i want to do at the moment is get the client working, meaning, this should be in client help. I am running two .bat files at moment one with a listener port of 43594 and the other of 43595, but it only connects to the on with 43595.

EDIT: Please close, Have fixed the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with multiple worlds? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:4, topic:534262”][quote author=hadesflames link=topic=653060.msg4375979#msg4375979 date=1382057392]

just use different heightz

You can go ahead and ignore that…

Have a look at this:

https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=520953.5

I don’t know if that will work or if it’s good as I didn’t read through it, but it should at least be a step in the right direction…
[/quote]Dude i was serious, why are you telling him to ignore my comment? it would be SO EASIEr to have it in different heights. for everything. i mean for the world thingy, you can put that if your friend is on the height for example for, it says world2, i dont know if you know that the height resets every 4 levels.
And before telling the author to ignore, you should atleast have thinked that its an option.[/quote]

Because you’re wrong…Having different worlds work in different heights is just an invitation for problems later on, ESPECIALLY since he’s planning on running a spawn server on one, and an eco on another. What about mini games that use different heights for different instances? For example, on my server if two clans go into zombies, each clan ends up in a different height level so there is no interference. Now if I add a second world on the same server just in a different height, I have completely unnecessary complications with my worlds and my minigames. Not to mention the issue of having to separate spawn and eco commands based on heights for the OP, a problem that is made harder by minigames that take advantage of height levels to allow multiple people/clans/w\e to play the same minigame at the same time as others without having to wait for them to finish.

I get where you’re coming from. It seems like less effort to just do it using the heights. It may even seem like a creative solution, but when you really think about it, it’s just not…

Read full topic

@Wintercanon wrote:

In that case, heights would be awesome for instanced areas.
